product_overview: A modern, minimalist web-based frontend interface for the lawsa automation platform enabling users to register, login, design, configure, and execute workflow automations visually with a focus on simplicity and usability.
core_goals: Provide secure user authentication and session management.
Enable users to visually create and manage automation workflows via a drag-and-drop editor.
Allow execution of workflows with real-time output and logging.
Facilitate credential management to securely handle API keys and passwords.
Deliver a responsive, accessible, and minimalist user experience with robust error handling.
key_features: User registration and login with JWT-based authentication and session handling.
Minimalist home page with navigation to registration and login, plus route-based navigation using React Router.
Visual workflow editor with drag-and-drop node editing, multiple node types, edge connection management, and dynamic node configuration.
Workflow management including creating, saving, loading, and listing workflows and templates integrated with backend APIs.
Run workflows with real-time streaming of execution output, error display, and execution history viewing.
Credential management with add/edit/delete functionality, secure backend integration, and validation.
Responsive, accessible UI with black/white theme, keyboard navigation, error messaging, and loading indicators.
user_flow_summary: User registers or logs in using email and password forms with validation and error handling.
Authenticated users access the home page and navigate to the workflow editor through protected routes.
Users create or load workflows; drag and drop nodes onto the visual canvas and configure each node’s properties.
Users connect nodes with edges ensuring valid connections; can add, move, or delete nodes and edges via context menus.
Users save workflows with metadata to the backend and load existing workflows or templates for editing.
Users assign and manage credentials securely, linking them to tool nodes within workflows.
Users run workflows, monitor real-time output and execution logs, and view past execution history and status.
validation_criteria: Successful user registration and login with proper error messages displayed.
JWT tokens stored and sessions managed with auto-redirect on expiration.
Visual workflow editor supports drag-and-drop node addition, configuration, and valid edge creation.
Workflows can be saved to and loaded from backend APIs with accurate metadata.
Run executions stream outputs and logs correctly, and errors are handled gracefully.
Credential management validates input formats, persists credentials securely, and assigns them properly to nodes.
UI is responsive, accessible, uses the black/white theme, and presents consistent error and loading states.
